meanings.definition: A motor that uses error-sensing feedback to control the position of a mechanical system.
meanings.sent1: The servomotor in the robot arm adjusts its position based on feedback.
meanings.sent2: The servomotor in the CNC machine ensures precise positioning of the cutting tool.
meanings.sent3: The servomotor at the heart of the toy robot kept spinning in circles, trying to find its way.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a servomotor, constantly adjusting to reach her goals.
meanings.sent5: The servomotor hummed softly as it delicately moved the camera into position.

meanings.definition: A type of motor that is used in automation and robotics to achieve precise control of movement.
meanings.sent1: The servomotor in the robotic arm smoothly controlled its movements.
meanings.sent2: The servomotor in the automated conveyor belt ensured products were placed accurately.
meanings.sent3: The servomotor at the party robotically danced to the music, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a servomotor, carefully guiding the conversation in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The servomotor purred as it flawlessly adjusted the angle of the solar panel.
